description: This header file defines the 'RequestHandler' class within the WPEFramework Plugin namespace. It declares methods for managing application lifecycle events, such as launch, terminate, send intent, and update state, as well as accessing various component handlers. The class appears to implement the singleton pattern, providing a static 'getInstance' method and a private constructor.

classes.name: RequestHandler
classes.description: Manages application lifecycle requests, maintains references to component handlers, and implements singleton pattern within the WPEFramework plugin.

methods.name: RequestHandler(const RequestHandler& obj)
methods.description: Deleted copy constructor to prevent copying of singleton instance.

methods.name: static RequestHandler* getInstance()
methods.description: Returns the singleton instance of RequestHandler.

methods.name: bool initialize(PluginHost::IShell* service, IEventHandler* eventHandler)
methods.description: Initializes the request handler with service and event handler references.

methods.name: void terminate()
methods.description: Cleanly terminates and cleans up resources.

methods.name: bool launch(ApplicationContext* context, const string& launchIntent, const Exchange::ILifecycleManager::LifecycleState targetLifecycleState, string& errorReason)
methods.description: Launches an application with specified intent and target state.

methods.name: bool terminate(ApplicationContext* context, bool force, string& errorReason)
methods.description: Terminates an application, with an option to force termination.

methods.name: bool sendIntent(ApplicationContext* context, const string& intent, string& errorReason)
methods.description: Sends an intent to an application or component.

methods.name: bool updateState(ApplicationContext* context, Exchange::ILifecycleManager::LifecycleState targetLifecycleState, string& errorReason)
methods.description: Updates the lifecycle state of the application.

methods.name: RuntimeManagerHandler* getRuntimeManagerHandler()
methods.description: Returns pointer to the runtime manager handler.

methods.name: WindowManagerHandler* getWindowManagerHandler()
methods.description: Returns pointer to the window manager handler.

methods.name: IEventHandler* getEventHandler()
methods.description: Returns pointer to the event handler.
